DataElement.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Second Edition Total Intrusions Z Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the Z score for the Total Intrusions subtest in the California Verbal Learning Test - Second Edition.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Second Edition Total Intrusions Z-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The second version of California Verbal Learning Test, a neuropsychological test developed to make a comprehensive and detailed assessment of verbal learning and memory in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 89 years._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._Inclusions of words that were not on the test list._Indicates how far and in what direction an item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of its distribution's standard deviation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Second Edition
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The second version of California Verbal Learning Test, a neuropsychological test developed to make a comprehensive and detailed assessment of verbal learning and memory in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 89 years.

Concepts.longName: California Verbal Learning Test - Second Edition
Concepts.definition: The second version of California Verbal Learning Test, a neuropsychological test developed to make a comprehensive and detailed assessment of verbal learning and memory in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 89 years.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:Inclusions of words that were not on the test list.:Indicates how far and in what direction an item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of its distribution's standard deviation.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Inclusions of words that were not on the test list.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. The z-score indicates how far and in what direction an item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of standard deviation. Calculation of a z-score requires knowledge about the population's standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: CVLT-II:California Verbal Learning Test-Second Edition. Delis, D., Kramar, J., Kaplan, E., and Ober, B., The Psychological Corporation: San Antonio, TX. 2000
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for COG study in Rave per request by W.Wong. mc 3/5/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that indicates how far and in what direction an item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of standard deviation. Calculation of a z-score requires knowledge about the population's standard deviation and mean.
